page.title: 06TRANSPORT IN WYDDIAL
page.content: A bus service runs along the B1368 on the eastern edge of the area,one and half miles from the village.It connects the villages of Anstey to the east and Hormead and Hare Street to the south with Royston the market town to the north.One bus runs into Royston and one out on Wednesday and Saturdays only.These are market days. People otherwise depend on their own cars,lifts from friends or taxis which come from Buntingford 2 miles to the south west. Buntingford also has a transport organisation run by volunteers which will take people to hospital,health centre appointments or on similiar essential journeys.Wyddial people use this service for which they pay the cost of the petrol. Taxis,paid for by the District Council,take children to school.
